t: Amazonians Know These Floating Islands Weren't Made by Giant Anacondas—But They Still Get Freaked Out by Them - Atlas Obscura
s: May 12, 2015 - In the floodplains of the Brazilian Amazon, in lakes where the currents are not too strong, there are floating forest islands—locals call them matupás. It’s difficult to walk on the surface. They are, Carolina Freitas was told, very dangerous places.

t: Floating island - Wikipedia
s: 1 week ago - Floating artificial islands are generally made of bundled reeds, and the best known examples are those of the Uros people of Lake Titicaca, Peru, who build their villages upon what are in effect huge rafts of bundled totora reeds.
